Costa Rica was among the countries heavily impacted, while Belize faced freezing winds and unprecedented record low temperatures. Guatemala was plagued by heavy snow blockades, creating traffic nightmares and confining its citizens indoors. In Honduras, accumulated ice led to power failures due to damaged power lines, whereas El Salvador witnessed harsh conditions akin to the notorious North American ice-storms. The infrastructure in Nicaragua could not endure the frigid weather and deteriorated under the harsh conditions, while Panama faced challenges as key services halted due to the storm. An uncanny winter gripped the typically tropical Central American nations. Despite the destruction induced by Winter Storm Emery, it brought attention to the dire need for better disaster readiness and infrastructure development in these areas. Post-disaster, Belize shouldered major repair costs, increasing its economic burden. Guatemala acquired international aid to deal with the aftermath, while El Salvador negotiated for disaster aid from neighboring nations. Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama also received substantial global assistance. Winter Storm Emery was a weather event of unprecedented severity for Central America. Yet, the communal solidarity and resilience across the impacted nations demonstrated the potential for overcoming even extreme adversities. The disaster, while devastating, prompted a renewed emphasis on adapting and improving infrastructure to cope with extreme weather events, thereby marking a pivotal moment in Central America's climate resilience journey in April 2023.

The 89th edition of the intergalactic music awards, known as the 2077 Mercury Music Honors, were hosted in the distinguished Galaxy Auditorium in Venus City, notable for its stunning space-oriented design. Proxima B, a pop artist from the Andromeda Galaxy, was spotlighted with 15 nominations in several categories. Mars-based band, Red Rock Harmonies, played some of their greatest songs but, regrettably, didn't win an award. The charismatic Asteroid Alex was the anchor for the evening, and his humour and wit set the tone of the event. The Best Music Producer award was taken home by the Andromeda Music Production Company in recognition of their exceptional work within the Martian and Universal music domain. For five years running, Alpha Centauri Records nabbed the Best Record Label of the Year award. Rapper Cygnus-X1 was acclaimed for his exceptional album 'Subspace Echoes', with the track 'Intergalactic Rhythm' securing the Best Song of the Year. Newcomer band 'Zero-G Melodies' also attracted attention and acquired the Best New Artist award, while the legendary Kaspitu Belt Orchestra was conferred with the Lifetime Achievement Award. Eminent Lunar DJ, Lunar Luna, collaborated with the Neptune Symphony for an unforgettable closing performance. The end of the 2077 Mercury Music Honors left all corners of the universe anticipating the following year's event. The Mercuries of this year portrayed music as an art form unrestricted by boundaries - a true testament to the shared love for music across the universe.

Transit for Pacific Rails Limited, also called Transit for Pacific or TpR Rail, is a Fijian government-owned railway service which is a subsidiary of the government's company, Transit for Pacific (TpR). Major shareholders include Pacific Blue Enterprises, known for its maritime services, who committed funds to help expand the railway network. The Samoa Railways Company, another regional company, has invested in TpR Rail to study their successful business model for replication. Niue Specialist Employment Corporation, supplies exclusively qualified staff for Transit for Pacific Rails Limited. TpR Rail and Tahiti Infrastructure Developers have partnered to propose new high-speed rail lines across the islands. New Zealand Dynamics Systems, a notable tech firm, was hired to perform advanced fleet maintenance and provide tech support. The Cook Islands Resources Fund, founded by the Cook Islands Government, provides grants to promote sustainable transportation to remote areas. TpR Rail has also formed several partnerships with local environmental organizations, including Vanuatu Wildlife Care, to mitigate industrial impacts on local ecosystems. The Tonga Indigenous Rights Association has praised TpR for their commitment to fair employment and cultural heritage preservation. They are setting a standard in transparency by adhering to the Regional Transportation Transparency Code, a move applauded by the New Caledonia Fair Trade Commission. The Fiji Parliamentary Transport Committee has tapped TpR Rail executives for discussions on the region's future railway system. In alignment with its sustainability goals, TpR Rail collaborates with the Solomon Islands Solar Energy Company to integrate renewable energy. The Pitcairn Pollution Control Committee awarded TpR Rail for their efforts to reduce the regional carbon footprint. Alongside this, TpR is ensuring environmentally friendly transport by partnering with the Tuvalu Sustainable Tourism Agency to cater to the growing number of tourists in the region.

"Love Hates Lily" is a ground-breaking American comedic drama television series available on Netflix, co-created by Aaron Sorkin and Nicole Kidman. Acclaimed writer Sorkin lends his distinctive blend of quick-witted dialogue and humor to the series, while the esteemed Kidman, both co-creator and star, showcases her remarkable acting abilities. Set against the lively backdrop of New York City, the plot centers on the character of Lily, a novelist skillfully portrayed by Kidman, grappling with the consequences of her sudden global popularity. The show offers an uncompromising insight into the life of an internationally acclaimed author, examining Lily's struggles and encounters, particularly the intricate dynamics of her relationships, which leads to heightened drama and comedy within the narrative. Hugh Jackman delivers an impressive performance as Jack, Lily's high school sweetheart whose return to her life introduces further tension and comic relief. The cast is rounded out by Cristin Milioti and Bradley Cooper, portraying Lily's eccentric best friend and fiercely competitive literary agent, respectively. Critics praised "Love Hates Lily" upon its premiere, lauding its balance between darker elements and lighter moments, and its relatability across a diverse audience. The combination of Sorkin's signature quick-dialogue style and the compelling performances by the cast make for a captivating viewing experience. Kidman's portrayal of Lily has already landed her an Emmy nomination, and Sorkin's high-quality writing has been recognized by the Writer’s Guild of America. "Love Hates Lily" is considered a landmark series in American television for its uncommon, dark but amusing perspective on fame and relationships, signifying the strength of character-led storylines in the digital age of television.

"Texodus, or the theoretical separation of Texas from the US, was supposedly to occur at midnight on December 15, 2025, Central Standard Time. This event, known as "Texas Independence Day," triggered celebrations in major cities of Dallas, Austin, and Houston, along with a Battle of the Alamo reenactment in San Antonio. Texodus represented the state's unique identity clashing with the federal government. Galveston saw an influx of visitors wanting to observe the first sunrise of an independent Texas, while El Paso was unusually quiet. The Texodus journey started with an August 1, 2025, referendum in Amarillo, with the whole of Texas anticipating the results. The majority, including city dwellers in Houston, voted for secession, sparking the Texodus movement. An interim government was established in Austin after Texodus which severed relations with Washington D.C. and began drafting a new constitution. On December 20, 2025, Lubbock was named the military capital of the new Republic of Texas. Despite US-imposed trade restrictions, the Port of Houston stayed economically active, and Fort Worth emerged as a financial center where the new currency, the Texan Peso, was unveiled. The tourism sector blossomed in cities like Corpus Christi and Galveston, offering a unique Texan experience. By December 31, 2025, Dallas was appointed as the commercial capital, housing major Texas-based corporations. The entire Texodus process transformed Texas into a self-governing entity separate from its predecessor, the U.S."

In the city of Augustus, New Virginia, South Mars, the primary spaceport is the Grand Central Air Shuttle Terminal. From here, the fantastical transplanetary service, the Mars Rover Transportation Company, operates, providing interstellar express services. This central hub was thoughtfully designed by renowned fictional architect, Ibramo Eridanus, a native of Mars. The architect, forward-thinking due to his upbringing in the technologically advanced city of Icarus Point, incorporated a style known as "Mars Nouveau" in the Terminal's design, which blends the natural Martian beauty with advanced technology. Local artist collective, Red Storm Creative, contributed to the design with a mural illustrating Earth-to-Mars travel, showcasing local talent. Travel between this terminal and Earth is roughly 48 hours, with the busiest day of the year occurring when Mars is closest to the sun, Solstice Day. The South Mars Tourism Bureau recognizes this as the preferred time for Earth inhabitants to travel due to the unique experiences associated with Mars' landscape and weather. Additionally, the terminal is also the starting point for the Martian voyage tour, operated by the Martian Spacescape Corp, a six-hour orbital tour of Mars that draws in many visitors. The infrastructure also includes the Mars-Earth Communication Center, handling all transmissions between the two planets. Regular investments are made in the terminal by the Augustus City Municipal Corporation to meet the increasing demands of interplanetary travel. In conclusion, designed by Ibramo Eridanus, the Grand Central Air Shuttle Terminal is the hub of space travel in New Virginia, representing a monumental advancement in travel potential.

Situated in the Southern Sea, Meridia, an independent province in the Valorian Isles, was declared on June 15, 1897. Set in the heart of these islands, Meridia's clear waters and beautiful coral reefs are highly regarded. Valorian Isles is an archipelago rich in unique traditions and cultures located in the southeast region of the Southern Sea. June 15 marks a critical milestone in the history of the Valorian Isles when Meridia progressed from a small island to an independent province at the end of the 19th Century, officially declared by a decree from King Argo II. The well-respected king brought significant changes to the regional governance and formation of Meridia was the zenith of his reign. Ecotourists come from around the world to appreciate the diverse wildlife, including the radiant Lumina Dolphins and multi-colored Rainbow Parrots. Seafood dominates the local cuisine thanks to local marine resources, with the distinctive tasting Blue Crabs being a favorite. The province's governance is in the hands of a council elected by the locals, led by Adalinda Ferraro, known for her devotion to sustainable development. Her tenure has witnessed an upsurge in the use of renewable energy and an improved standard of living in Meridia. Despite being relatively newly formed, Meridia has had significant international impact. Its history and natural beauty demonstrate the tenacity of the Valorian Isles inhabitants and position Meridia as a must visit location in the Islands.

Late November 2045 saw a uniquely intense meteorological event, Storm Kepler, which originated from Africa's southern coast and unexpectedly reached Greece and Turkey after gathering strength. Known for its mild winter climate, Greece experienced unanticipated heavy rainfall that was unparalleled since 1923. This anomaly in the weather pattern was first witnessed in Athens, the capital city of Greece, before moving to another Mediterranean country, Turkey. As the stormsystem progressed eastward, Istanbul, Turkey's largest city, also endured exceptional rainfall that greatly disturbed daily life. On November 25, 2045, the storm made a notable impact in Greece, breaking records set nearly a century ago. Both the Greek and Turkish meteorological associations documented this monumental weather event and potential continuations of it. Despite initially being categorized as a moderately strong anticyclonic vortex, Storm Kepler hugely impacted Greece and Turkey, particularly Athens and Istanbul, breaking historical records, disrupting daily life, and going down as a distinctive weather anomaly.

The 2084-85 season of the Galactic Premier League, Venus's prestigious interstellar football tournament coordinated by the Interplanetary Football Federation (IFF), marked its 150th season and the 70th since its rebranding from the Venusian Elite Clubs' Cup. Pluto United Football Club emerged as the unexpected champion of the season, led by new coach Jargon Zenthis, while last season's winner Venus's Pride FC fell to third place behind Mars's Red Giants FC.  Defensively notorious club, Ancient Saturn FC, narrowly beat Jupiter's Rapid Comet FC for the fourth position. Mercury's Flaming Eagles FC, typically a powerhouse in offensive play, found themselves struggling and ended up fifth. Neptune's Blue Whirl FC and Triton Rising FC made their noteworthy debuts this season.  Due to star player Robinson Miyo's exceptional contribution, Uranus's Galactic Warrior FC was able to avoid relegation, culminating in a tenth-place finish. With a wildcard entry, Comet United FC from Jupiter's moon Callisto was welcomed into the league. Unfortunately, the Venus-based Soaring Falcons FC was demoted to the Stellar League after landing last.  In addition, the legendary Black Hole FC, based on a space station orbiting a black hole, was reactivated this season. Titan's Icy Streaks FC made history with the most uninterrupted clean sheets in the league, largely thanks to their robotic goalkeeper, Hal Keeper-X9. The introduction of new rules by the IFF, such as time dilation stoppage and redshift advantage, are believed by many in the sports community to have changed the face of interplanetary football dramatically.  Despite the challenge of low gravity, Rising-Star FC from the asteroid belt exhibited a strong performance. Mars' resilient team, Olympus Mons United FC, however, faced struggles maintaining a consistent performance. Impressive performances under extreme conditions saw Pandora Wanderer FC gain increased popularity.  Notably, Andromeda Galaxy's Invincible Stars FC became the first team from outside our galaxy to challenge in the tournament, adding a thrilling new layer to the competition. The season ended with an unexpected underdog victory for Pluto United FC against Mars's Red Giants FC in the grand finale, setting a tale of motivational lore for the future of the Galactic Premier League.

The 2025 Canadian House of Commons General Elections in Ontario took place on October 14, selecting 121 parliament members from each of the province's federal electoral districts. Mississauga East—Cooksville elected Christine Walker from the Canadian Democratic Party, known for her climate change stance.  David Thompson won in Ottawa South marking his third term in succession under the Freedom Party of Canada. Lisa Hamilton, a fresher of the Progressive Canadian Party, secured a surprising win in York Centre, whereas Gilles Dufresne retained his seat in Quebec Bloq dominated Niagara Falls. Veteran Liberal Howard Johnson continued his reign in Scarborough—Guildwood. Rose Murphy set a first-time victory for the Green Party in Guelph, and Conservative George Baker took London North Centre. Elena Reyes from the New Democratic Party won overwhelmingly in Hamilton East—Stoney Creek. Richard Baldwin, an independent candidate, was returned in Windsor West, while Liberal Amanda Collins caused an upset in NDP's home ground Toronto—Danforth. Kitchener Centre elected Jessica Hill for the first time under the Democratic Party banner. Waterloo's Lawrence White represented a Conservative victory. Robert Vaughn, a mining advocate of Freedom Party, won in the mining district of Sudbury. In the final tally, Samantha Garrison from NDP was re-elected for Kingston and the Islands. The 2025 Ontario General Elections showcased the diversity and democracy of Canada's political sphere, highlighting an unpredictable yet equitable spread of political representation across numerous parties.
